elementSpec.desc: contains one whole corpus, stored in the corpus root file comprising the corpus header and XInclude references to corpus component files, each containing a TEI element.

exemplum.p: General structure of a ParlaMint corpus root:

elementSpec.desc: is an element from the XML namespace of the XML Inclusions (XInclude) W3C recommendation. It is used to include, into a ParlaMint teiCorpus root file the elements of the corpus that are stored as separate files. These are the TEI corpus components and parts of the corpus root teiHeader. Inside particDesc these are listPerson & listOrg, and taxonomy inside classDecl.

exemplum.p: Using XInclude in ParlaMint to include corpus components into the corpus root:

elementSpec.desc: contains a single TEI-conformant document, combining a single TEI header with one or more members of the model.resource class. Multiple TEI elements may be combined within a TEI (or teiCorpus) element.

exemplum.p: Example of ParlaMint corpus component:

elementSpec.desc: contains a single text of any kind, whether unitary or composite, for example a poem or drama, a collection of essays, a novel, a dictionary, or a corpus sample.
contains the whole body of a single unitary text, excluding any front or back matter.
contains division of the body a corpus component.

valItem.desc: General purpose text division for all parts of parliamentary proceedings. It should include at least one utterance. If needed, the @subtype attribute can be used for additional content classification.
A special purpose text division used as a container for transcriber comments. Should not contain any utterances. If needed, the @subtype attribute can be used for additional content classification.

elementSpec.desc: contains a note or annotation.

valItem.desc: Description in the third person of events taking place in the meeting, e.g. "Mr X. takes the Chair".
Summaries of speeches that are individually not interesting, e.g. "Question put and agreed to".
Name, role and possible description of a person doing the speech
The location of the speaker, who was not on the podium
Date and time of the beginning and end of the debate
The presence of the members of parliament
Comments on the conduct of debates

exemplum.p: note element is used to encode transcriber comments such as who spoke, what the time was, interruptions, notes on what is happening in the chamber, results of voting etc.:
exemplum.egXML: The president, Dr. Milan Brglez: ... The session began at 10 o'clock. ... 84 voted for the adoption of the measure. ... 2 voted against the adoption of the measure. ...

exemplum.p: The note element can be further qualified by the time element to specify the date and time recorded in the note; and can also contain a page break, pb:
The note element may also be used to mark any additional information on debate sections:

egXML.div: Business Before Questions Death of a Member ... ... End of debateSection.

elementSpec.desc: marks any vocalized but not necessarily lexical phenomenon, for example voiced pauses, non-lexical backchannels, etc.

vocal.desc: Interruption from the chair: Your time is up.

elementSpec.desc: marks any communicative phenomenon, not necessarily vocalized, for example a gesture, frown, etc.

kinesic.desc: sign for the end of discussion

elementSpec.desc: marks any phenomenon or occurrence, not necessarily vocalized or communicative, for example incidental noises or other events affecting communication.

incident.desc: He stands and with him the whole Assembly
The Assembly observed a minute of silence. Applause.
Arrival of the President of the Republic of Poland

elementSpec.desc: indicates a point where material has been omitted in a transcription, whether for editorial reasons described in the TEI header, as part of sampling practice, or because the material is illegible, invisible, or inaudible.
contains a short description of the purpose, function, or use of its parent element, or when the parent is a documentation element, describes or defines the object being documented.

exemplum.egXML:
Example of desc elements for transcriber comments:
speaker spoke too quietly, not understood
ploskanje
sounds from the chamber
...
signal for end of debate
...
minute of silence

exemplum.p: Example of desc elements used as a part of taxonomy:
Element desc can also be used to describe tool(s) used to linguistically annotate the corpus:

application.label: ReLDI tokeniser
application.desc: Tokenisation and sentence segmentation with ReLDI tokeniser, available from https://github.com/clarinsi/reldi-tokeniser.

elementSpec.desc: contains a single-word, multi-word, or symbolic designation which is regarded as a technical term.

exemplum.p: term is used inside taxonomies to name the taxonomy and its categories:

egXML.taxonomy:
Podkorpusi
Subcorpora
Referenca: referenƒçni podkorpus, do 2019-10-31
Reference: reference subcorpus, until 2019-10-31
...

egXML.catDesc: acl: Clausal modifier of noun (adjectival clause)

elementSpec.desc: defines a reference to another location, possibly modified by additional text or comment.

projectDesc.p: ParlaMint is a project that aims to create a multilingual set of comparable corpora of parliamentary proceedings uniformly encoded according to the Parla-CLARIN recommendations and ...

elementSpec.desc: marks the beginning of a new page in a paginated document.
contains a stretch of speech usually preceded and followed by silence or by a change of speaker.

exemplum.p: The element u marks up a speech, as illustrated below:

u.seg: I ask that the draft Regulations laid before the House on 5 December be approved.
The relevant document is the 20th Report from the Legislation Committee.

elementSpec.desc: represents any segmentation of text below the chunk level.

u.seg: I ask that the draft Regulations laid before the House on 5 December be approved.
The relevant document is the 20th Report from the Legislation Committee.

elementSpec.desc: contains a sentence-like division of a text.
represents a grammatical (not necessarily orthographic) word.

exemplum.p: Certain frameworks, in particular the Universal Dependencies, allow for tokens to be decomposed into several words, and it is these syntactic words, and not tokens, that are further annotated. For example, Czech has the word ‚Äòabyste‚Äô which is in UD decomposed into two syntactic words, ‚Äòaby‚Äô and ‚Äòbyste‚Äô, which can be encoded in the w element:

elementSpec.desc: contains a character or string of characters regarded as constituting a single punctuation mark.
defines a collection of associations or hypertextual links.

exemplum.p: Syntactic analysis is stored in the link group, linkGrp element, which is then composed of link elements. The example below illustrating this is given, for readability, without the word-level linguistic attributes and with shortened IDs:

elementSpec.desc: defines an association or hypertextual link among elements or passages, of some type not more precisely specifiable by other elements.

exemplum.p: Element link, given in linkGrp joins two tokens according to their syntactic dependency. The example below illustrating this is given, for readability, without the word-level linguistic attributes and with shortened IDs:

elementSpec.desc: contains a proper noun or noun phrase.

exemplum.p: Element name is used in the TEI header to specify location of the parliament:
The element is used in the TEI header to denote person's responsibility for changes:

The element is also used to mark up Named Entities in the linguistically analysed corpus, in which case it should have the type attribute with one of the allowed values. It can also have a ref attribute to link it a definition:

elementSpec.desc: contains a number, written in any form.

exemplum.p: The element can be used for fine-grained Named Entities which include numbers:

elementSpec.desc: contains a date in any format.

exemplum.p: The element date gives the date in the when attribute in the ISO 8601 format, while the textual content is not constrained:
The textual content can be given according to the conventions used in the local language:

elementSpec.desc: contains a phrase defining a time of day in any format.

exemplum.p: A note giving the time when e.g. the session started:

elementSpec.desc: contains an email address identifying a location to which email messages can be delivered.
